messages.author: Person1
messages.text: Are you feeling OK? You sound a little tired this morning.

messages.author: Person2
messages.text: I did not sleep much last night. I really feel bad. It was a crazy night.

messages.author: Person2
messages.text: I had a bad dream. I was walking alone in the graveyard, and suddenly all the ghosts jumped out of their graves. They began to chase me through the graveyard and shouted that they wanted my blood.

messages.author: Person1
messages.text: Oh, what a nightmare! Then what happened?

messages.author: Person2
messages.text: My mother woke me up. She had heard me crying out for help.

messages.author: Person1
messages.text: You have got a great mother.

messages.author: Person2
messages.text: I felt embarrased. After all, I am 18 years old. Mom gave me some chocolate cookies and a glass of milk.

messages.author: Person2
messages.text: Yeah, but i was afraid to fall back asleep. I am worrying about getting into the University of Michigan.

messages.author: Person1
messages.text: Me too. But I tell myself that if they don't accept me, another school will.

refs: Fanny had a nightmare because of the pressure from school applications. Her mother and Andy both comfort her.

messages.author: Person1
messages.text: How did you get interested in country music?

messages.author: Person2
messages.text: Well, bila isteri aku and I first caught our record player. We started to buy all kinds of records, soon, I found that I was buying more country music records than any other kind.

messages.author: Person1
messages.text: Macam mana kau start working for the radio station?

messages.author: Person2
messages.text: I thought there should be a radio program of country songs, so I went to CBC, and suggested it. That was how we started the program called Golden Country Time.

messages.author: Person1
messages.text: Lepas tu kau dipanggil to write articles to explain the background of those songs.

messages.author: Person2
messages.text: Yes, tapi aku pun penat of running to the library to find information. So I started buying country song books and building library aku sendiri.

summary: #Person2# explains to #Person1# about how #Person2# got interested in country music and started the program.
refs: #Person2# explains to #Person1# about how #Person2# got interested in country music and started the program.

messages.author: Person1
messages.text: Adam, how is your knee hari ni? Is it still giving you trouble?

messages.author: Person2
messages.text: No, hari ni rasa lebih bagus. I went to the doctor and he told me it was not serious, I should be fine for Saturday.

messages.author: Person1
messages.text: Great! Tapi kenapa hari ni kamu tak nak relax? Maybe just practice throwing. Don't do any running.

messages.author: Person2
messages.text: OK. Do you have any news about Michigan and what we can expect in Saturday's game?

messages.author: Person1
messages.text: Yes, I have some films, showing Michigan in the last three games. They are in my office, kalau kamu nak tengok lepas practice, you can.

messages.author: Person2
messages.text: Oh, that would be great. I'd like to see what we are up against. They are one of the top basketball teams in the country now since they beat Iowa last weekend.

messages.author: Person1
messages.text: Come to think of it, why don't you go ahead and check out the game films right now? And just rest that knee this afternoon. I want you to be well in three days. Michigan has a strong team. We are in for a tough one.

messages.author: Person2
messages.text: All right, saya akan datang balik esok for full practice.

summary: Adam's knee is getting better but #Person1# still suggests that he should not do any running today. Adam decides to watch the films of Michigan after practice and will be back tomorrow for full practice.
refs: Adam's knee is getting better but #Person1# still suggests that he should not do any running today. Adam decides to watch the films of Michigan after practice and will be back tomorrow for full practice.

messages.text: Charlie: Aku pun ada baca kalau kita nampak strangers dalam mimpi, in fact we must have seen them somewhere before. Kita punya otak tak boleh create such images on its own, it must have registered some random people's faces, dan dia gunakkan gambar itu bila kita mimpi.

messages.text: Nowadays, ships and boats tak penting sangat dalam transportation as they used to be.

messages.text: Betul. With the extension of railways and highways, and the improvement of safety and capacity of airplanes, ships and boats have been giving place to trains, planes and automobiles.

messages.author: Person1
messages.text: Aku baca dalam newspapers that the passenger liners from Shanghai to Ningpo and Dalian have been out of business ; and the liners up and down the Yangtze River have been reduced by 70 %.

messages.author: Person2
messages.text: The pace of life of people is now getting faster and faster, so the speed of ships and boats seems to be so lembab. I think it may be the reason why people don't like to travel by boat.

messages.author: Person1
messages.text: But the most of the transoceanic cargo transportation is still carried by boat.

summary: #Person2# explains alternatives of sea transportation but #Person1# addresses the importance of boat in transoceanic cargo transportation.

messages.author: Person1
messages.text: Tim, you're going to talk about your project and how to lead a greener life. Kenapa kau pilih subject tu?

messages.author: Person2
messages.text: Well. We'd learned a lot about the environment in our science lessons, so I decided to see what I could do in my own life rather than just act completely helpless. And I knew the rest of my family would be interested.

messages.author: Person1
messages.text: Kau rasa senang to get information tak?

messages.author: Person2
messages.text: Yeah, I discovered there were lots of people at my age trying to be green. I'd always gone to school by car. Catching a bus would be better, but there's no bus where we live. So I've gone for riding my bike ke sekolah sekarang.

messages.author: Person1
messages.text: OK. And what about being green once you're actually at school?

messages.author: Person2
messages.text: Well, I realized that although all school paper was recycled and most of my friends use both sides of paper. We use huge quantities and I thought we should cut down and then it came to me that we should be sending in most of our work electronically. I'm going to recommend it to our teachers.

messages.author: Person2
messages.text: One school I've read about has meatless Mondays. It's good to use local produce, too. That something yang sekolah kita dah buat, but we still have machines with bottled milk, water and juices for sale. And I think we shouldn't have them.

summary: Tim's project is about how to lead a greener life. #Person1# consults about his motivation and his findings at school. Tim finds there are many aspects that can be improved for his school.
refs: Tim's project is about how to lead a greener life. #Person1# consults about his motivation and his findings at school. Tim finds there are many aspects that can be improved for his school.

messages.text: You know that is tempting but is really not good for our fitness.

messages.author: Person1
messages.text: Mary, why are you so tired?

messages.author: Person2
messages.text: I go to the personnel market every day, and put a lot of energy into it.

messages.author: Person1
messages.text: Why don't you think about applying for a job on the Internet?

messages.author: Person2
messages.text: On the Internet? I have never tried that way.

messages.author: Person1
messages.text: Well, it's very convenient and very popular now.

messages.author: Person2
messages.text: So how to apply for a job on the Internet?

messages.author: Person1
messages.text: Just get online and send your application through email to the employer.

messages.author: Person2
messages.text: But how can I know which employer is hiring?

messages.author: Person1
messages.text: You could place your job hunting information on the Job Wanted channel on a recruitment website.

messages.author: Person2
messages.text: Will the employers see my information?

messages.author: Person1
messages.text: Yes. If they think you are a fit, maybe they will contact you.

messages.author: Person2
messages.text: Is it safe to job hunt on the Internet?

messages.author: Person1
messages.text: If you log in some formal websites, it must be very safe.

messages.author: Person2
messages.text: I will give it a try at once.

summary: Mary is tired because of finding jobs in the market. #Person1# suggests Mary apply for jobs on the Internet and says she could place her information on the Job Wanted channel on a recruitment web. Mary will try at once.
refs: Mary is tired because of finding jobs in the market. #Person1# suggests Mary apply for jobs on the Internet and says she could place her information on the Job Wanted channel on a recruitment web. Mary will try at once.

messages.text: Person1: Seri ithoda introduction mudiyudhu. Ippo en talk oda first part kku polam adhu 2006 fiscal year marketing plan pathi. First right off the bat marketing plan paakkumbodhu indha varusham aarambathula naanga set panna goals konjam sollunga...

messages.author: S1
messages.text: Person2: Naanga younger set of consumers kku appeal pannanum aprom andha goal kooda serndhu enga image redo pannanum...

messages.author: S2
messages.text: Person1: Adhu correct. Ungalukku nyabagam irundhaa overseas markets la distribution double panna goal set pannonam. Ippo enga goals achieve pannonamaa illa nu evaluate panna data paakkumbodhu moonu vishayangal yosikkanum. First market oda original condition second previous year la irundhu enga marketing numbers third indha varusham oda final sales figures. Ippo naan rendu moonu parts pathi describe panna virumburen. Overhead la paartha graph theriyum... Blue line 2005 la irundhu enga sales represent pannudhu red line 2006 la sales... Neenga paakkura maadhiri 2005 la enga sales romba slow a start aagi irundhuchu aana varushathoda kadaisi part la decent performance panninom. Marupakkam indha varusham sales rocket maadhiri takeoff aagiduchu.

summary: #Person1# first introduces the 2006 fiscal year marketing plan then analyzes their performance and explains with the sale graph.
refs: #Person1# first introduces the 2006 fiscal year marketing plan then analyzes their performance and explains with the sale graph.

messages.author: S1
messages.text: Person2: Naan Susan paakka hospital poraen.

messages.author: S2
messages.text: Person1: Naan ava netthu paarthen. Ava konjam nalla irundha.

messages.author: S3
messages.text: Person2: Ange poga naan number 7 bus pidikkanumaa?

messages.author: S4
messages.text: Person1: Illa, thevai illa. Number 13 bus kooda unga hospital kootitu pogum.

messages.author: S5
messages.text: Person2: Number 13 bus romba frequent a varum illa?

messages.author: S6
messages.text: Person1: Aama. Naan netthu number 7 bus pidichen, avanga naan thappaana bus pidichiten nu sonnaanga.

messages.author: S7
messages.text: Person2: Nandri Henry. Naan number 13 pidikkaren.

messages.author: S8
messages.text: Person1: Aana number 13 bus town center la irundhu pogum. Neenga rendu mile nadandhu poga vendiyadhu irukkum.

summary: Jane is going to the hospital to see Susan. Henry tells her to catch the number 13.
refs: Jane is going to the hospital to see Susan. Henry tells her to catch the number 13.

messages.author: S0
messages.text: Person1: Library eppadi use pannuradhu nu solla mudiyumaa?

messages.author: S1
messages.text: Person2: Kandippa. Ungalukku student ID card illa admission card irundhaa pothum books edukkavum library la journals illa magazines padikkavum.

messages.author: S2
messages.text: Person1: Oru time la evlo books edukkalaam?

messages.author: S3
messages.text: Person2: Oru time la rendu books. Magazines illa journals mattum library la padikkanum.

messages.author: S5
messages.text: Person2: Oru maasam. Time la books thiruppi kodukka mudiyala na fine kattanum. Aana renew panna adhigama naal vechukalaam.

messages.author: S6
messages.text: Person1: Seri. Ippo spoken English pathi rendu books edukkanum. Adhu enga irukkum nu solla mudiyumaa?

messages.author: S7
messages.text: Person2: Aama unga right pakkam ange irukku.

summary: #Person1# asks #Person2# how to use the library. #Person2# offers specific directions.
refs: #Person1# asks #Person2# how to use the library. #Person2# offers specific directions.

messages.text: Person1: Tina, neenga evlo naala piano kathukittu irukinga?

messages.author: S4

messages.text: Person2: Aama, en teacher romba excellent aana aalunga, avanga romba awards vaangirukkaanga.

summary: Tina plays the piano well because she has an excellent teacher. She agrees to introduce #Person1# to her teacher.
